div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1144 Kerch, (anc. Panticapaeum), Crimea (555) oblast, Ukraine, 1897 Burial: 80-75 B.C. (Golenko) Contents: 5 AR, 468+ AE. In 2 lots, 2 meters apart Panticapaeum: 4 didr. (as BMC 11) 331 AE (as Minns, pl. 5, 19 [1], 24 [4]; BMC 17-18 [10], 23 [15], 35 [223], 39-40 [67], 44-46 [1]) Unc. Bosporus: 3 AE (as Minns, pl. 9, 21) Gorgippia: 40 AE (as Minns, pl. 9, 24) Phanagoria: 1 didr. (types of BMC Panti- capaeum 11) 28 AE (as BMC 7) Amisus: 62 AE (as RGA I.1, pl. 7, 22-24 [32], 25 and 27 [2]; pl. 8, 1-4 [28]) Comana: 1 AE (as RGA I.1, pl. 11, 25) Amastris: 1 AE (as RGA I.1, pl. 18, 15-16) Sinope: 2 AE (as RGA I.1, pl. 26, 17-18) Disposition: Leningrad (part, merged with main coll.); museum material lost during war (part) â€ DAK 1898, no. 7 OAK 1897 (publ. 1900), pp. 72-3 Zograph, Ol'viia 1940, p. 296 Pakhomov III, 947; VIII, suppl. to 947 (pp. 107-8) Golenko, Klio 46 (1965), pp. 318-9
